servinfo.title: DTC P0713: Transmission Fluid Temperature Sensor “A” Circuit High

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0712: Transmission Fluid Temperature Sensor “A” Circuit Low .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Transmission temperature sensor terminal voltage is less than 4.89 V under vehicle condition shown in the following.

item.ptxt: Ignition switch is turned on for 15 minutes or more
Engine coolant temperature is more than 50 °C (122 °F)
Transmission fluid temperature sensor or its circuit.

s1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch OFF.
Clear DTCs in TCM and ECM memories by using scan tool.
Start vehicle and increase vehicle speed to about 40 km/h (25 mile/h) for 20 minutes or more.
Check DTC, pending DTC and freeze-frame data.

testgroup.title: Check transmission fluid temperature sensor circuit for open

test1.ptxt: Check for proper connection to transmission fluid temperature sensor at terminal “E92-11” and “E92-12”.
If OK, check continuity between terminal “E92-11” and “E92-12” of disconnected harness side TCM connector.

testgroup.question: Is continuity indicated?

action.ptxt: Transmission fluid temperature sensor circuit is open circuit.

testgroup.title: Check transmission fluid temperature sensor circuit for power supply short

test1.ptxt: Cool down A/T fluid temperature under ambient temperature.
Connect TCM connectors to TCM with ignition switch OFF.
Measure voltage between terminal “E92-11” of TCM connector and ground.

testgroup.question: Is it 4.89 V or more?

action.ptxt: Transmission fluid temperature sensor circuit is shorted to power supply circuit. If circuit is OK, go to Step 4.
Intermittent trouble or faulty TCM. Check for intermittent trouble referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection . If OK, substitute a known-good TCM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Inspection transmission fluid temperature sensor referring to Transmission Fluid Temperature Sensor Inspection .

action.ptxt: Intermittent trouble or faulty TCM. Check for intermittent trouble referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection . If OK, substitute a known-good TCM and recheck.
Replace valve body harness including transmission fluid temperature sensor referring to Transmission Fluid Temperature Sensor Removal and Installation .
